title: A  Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Multi-Center Study of ALZ-309 (beta-amyloid antibody) in Patients With Atopic Dermatitis
officialTitle: A  Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Multi-Center Study of ALZ-309 (beta-amyloid antibody) in Patients With Atopic Dermatitis
description: This is a  double-blind, placebo-controlled multi-center study designed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of ALZ-309 (beta-amyloid antibody) in patients with Atopic Dermatitis. The study will enroll approximately 270 patients.
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 18-62 years
- Confirmed diagnosis of Atopic Dermatitis
- ECOG performance status 0-1
- Adequate organ function
- Willing and able to provide informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypersensitivity to study drug or excipients
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Participation in another interventional study within 30 days
- Significant cardiovascular disease within past 6 months
- Active or chronic infection requiring systemic treatment
